title: 113_hr697
content: The Act is titled the "Three Kids Mine Remediation and Reclamation Act" and defines terms like "Federal land" and "Henderson redevelopment agency." It also references the Comprehensive Environmental Response, Compensation, and Liability Act of 1980 for definitions of hazardous substances, pollutants, and remedies. The Henderson Redevelopment Agency has the authority to act in accordance with Nevada Community Redevelopment Law. The Responsible Party is designated by the agency to handle the Three Kids Mine Project Site. The Secretary refers to the Secretary of the Interior, and the State refers to Nevada. The Three Kids Mine Project Site consists of approximately 1,262 acres of land, including Federal and non-Federal land. The land conveyance is addressed in the Act. The Henderson Redevelopment Agency is designated to handle the Three Kids Mine Project Site, consisting of approximately 1,262 acres of land. The Secretary will convey Federal land to the agency, subject to conditions and fair market value payment. The Secretary will determine the fair market value of the Federal land through an appraisal conducted in accordance with nationally recognized standards. The Secretary will estimate the costs for assessing, remediating, and reclaiming the Three Kids Mine Project Site, following national appraisal standards and excluding historical mining contamination. The Phase II environmental site assessment for the Three Kids Mine Project Site must be based on a comprehensive report approved by the State and prepared according to ASTM International Standard E-2137-06 (2011). The Phase II environmental site assessment for the Three Kids Mine Project Site must follow ASTM International Standard E-1527-05 for Phase I and E-1903-11 for Phase II assessments. The Secretary will review cost information provided by the Henderson Redevelopment Agency, the Responsible Party, and the State for estimating costs. If there is a disagreement, they will jointly select experts to assist in making the final cost estimate. The Secretary will begin the appraisal and cost estimates within 30 days of the Act's enactment. The Henderson Redevelopment Agency or Responsible Party will reimburse appraisal costs. The fair market value of Federal land will be adjusted based on estimated remediation and reclamation costs. The conveyance of land is contingent on the execution of a mine remediation and reclamation agreement. The Secretary must receive written notification from the State that a mine remediation agreement has been executed and concur within 30 days. The agreement must be enforceable and obligate the Responsible Party to perform remediation work at the Three Kids Mine Project Site to protect human health and the environment from hazardous substances. The Three Kids Mine Project Site requires remediation and reclamation work to protect human health and the environment from hazardous substances. The Henderson Redevelopment Agency must provide notification for conveyance of Federal land within 90 days of executing the mine remediation agreement. Additionally, there are provisions for financial assurance to ensure completion of the remedy. The Henderson Redevelopment Agency is ready to accept the conveyance of Federal land as per the notification. The Federal land is withdrawn from various activities for a 10-year period, allowing for immediate conveyance after relinquishing unnecessary property. The applicable law is relinquished to exclude unnecessary property and allow immediate conveyance of Federal land. Existing Reclamation Project rights are preserved. The ACEC boundary is adjusted to exclude the Three Kids Mine Project Site. Parties are responsible for mine remediation and reclamation. The responsibility for mine remediation and reclamation under the agreement executed in section 3(b)(2) applies to the Responsible Party and the State of Nevada. If terms of the agreement are not met, the Secretary retains the responsibility to take necessary actions to protect public health and the environment. This Act does not modify or limit compliance with environmental laws. SEC. 7. SOUTHERN NEVADA PUBLIC LANDS MANAGEMENT ACT. The Southern Nevada Public Land Management Act of 1998 does not apply to land conveyed under this Act.
